text: [Music]
blow this is chef john from food
whooshes calm with prawn Provencal
that's right this easy appetizer was
inspired by the upcoming the Academy
Awards because it's gatherings like that
where we want to feature our fanciest
orders sure chips and dips are fine for
the Super Bowl but when George Clooney
is accepting the award for Best jaw line
in a Musical or Comedy we're going to
want something a little higher end and
not only are these delicious and kind of
fancy looking they are very easy to make
and we require prepping just two
components of course one of those
components has 10 ingredients but still
as you're about to see pretty easy so
with that let's go ahead and get started
with our garlic herb breadcrumb mixture
and I'm going to do that by transferring
some chopped garlic into a mortar
followed by a nice big pinch of kosher
salt we are also going to toss in a
pinch of dried oregano as well as a
little pinch of dried thyme so this
mixture is going to feature both dried
and fresh herbs
well actually fresh herb because at this
point I'm also going to toss in a little
bit of freshly chopped Italian parsley
and we're actually going to add most of
that at the end of this procedure but I
do like that a little bit here when we
smash our garlic to add a little bit of
coloration and then what we'll do before
we add our olive oil is grind and smash
that garlic down to a paste which is
going to take you a minute or two and
then what we'll do once that mixture has
been smashed and mash to our
satisfaction is go ahead and add our
olive oil and then we'll give that a mix
for about a minute to infuse that own
oil with all that goodness and by the
way if you don't have one of these well
you really should get one but if you
don't have one currently you can do this
in a blender you're just not going to
extract the same flavor as you do in the
mortar and then what we'll do once our
garlic herb oil mixture set is transfer
that into our breadcrumbs just good
old-fashioned plain dry breadcrumbs and
then once that's transferred in we'll go
ahead and add the rest of the
ingredients which will include some more
salt some freshly ground black pepper
and a little bit of cayenne just because
we can also add the rest of our freshly
chopped parsley and then last but not
least we'll do a little bit of freshly
grated Parmesan cheese and please use
the real stuff it goes by the name
parmigiano-reggiano and then once we
have everything together we'll take a
fork and give it a mix and by the way as
usual this is a technique not
necessarily recipe so if you want to
tweak this mixture with different herbs
and spices go ahead
you are after all the RuPaul of your
prom Provencal so you go ahead and add
whatever you think will make this more
fabulous but anyway we'll give this a
mix with a fork we also need to check to
make sure we have enough oil so what I
like to do is give it a mix and then
kind of feel it with my fingers and if
it feels a little bit dry which this did
we'll simply drizzle in a little more
olive oil and give it another mix until
we think it's perfect and right here is
exactly what we're shooting for
okay if we press some of this onto a
finger it will stick so that's looking
good right there and then what we'll do
once that's done is set it aside and
move on to the prawns which are actually
most likely shrimp so I'll cover this
very briefly on the blog post but to
make a long story short culinarily
speaking prawns and shrimp are the same
thing and we're simply calling them
prawns here for the alliteration and
we're going to need to do to prep these
is remove the shell but not to tell so
what some people like to do to play it
safe is to remove that piece of shell
just below the tail and then once that
separated they'll continue on moving
down the shrimp removing the rest of the
show so that's one way and while that
does take a little longer it is kind of
safe because you're less likely to
accidentally pull off the tail but
here's another way this is a little
faster and I think I prefer it but it is
a little more dangerous and that's to
use your thumb to scrape down across the
legs and then we'll go the other
direction removing the shell from the
thick part up to the tail so this is a
little faster but you got to be careful
when you get to the end that you don't
pull off the tail that's going to act as
our handle and then once our prawns are
peeled we have to butterfly them which
is totally different than how we usually
do it because we normally make a cut
about halfway in along the back here but
to butterfly shrimp you have to go in
the other side
okay the underbelly and we'll cut right
down the leg but do not go through
especially on the end here okay we want
to cut through that flesh just down to
the skin
so that the shrimp opens up but is still
attached in the center
so one down in a thousand ago sorry just
had a catering flashback and of course
once butterflied if you see a vein and
need to pull it out go ahead but anyway
let's try that one more time even though
I'm going to edit this one down so
instead of cutting into the back we're
going to cut into the underbelly and we
will slice that lengthwise but again do
not go all the way through and be
especially careful when you're near the
end okay so go a little bit slow till
you get the hang of it and then once our
shrimp are prepped and our crumbs are
made all the hard work is over and it's
probably obvious but I'll tell you
anyway
both those components can be prepped
ahead of time which is very much
recommended we can't be greedy and guess
which from hands so ideally you're doing
that earlier in the day and then what
we'll do once we do want to move into
final production is line a sheet pan
with foil and we'll give it a nice light
brushing with some olive oil and then
once that set we will apply our crumb
mixture to our prawns as shown ok I like
to press on a whole bunch to start and
then kind of shake that off and then
maybe reapply a little bit more because
what we're shooting for here is the
surface of that prawn is totally coated
with crumbs but just a nice light layer
we don't want it all piled up otherwise
the edges of those crumbs aren't going
to crisp up in the oven so we'll apply
very generous amount of crumbs and then
sort of let it fall off applying more if
necessary until they are lightly but
thoroughly coated and once that's done
if you see a few spots that need a
little extra go ahead and give it a
little extra pinch and then once our
prawns have been crumbed in pan they are
ready for the oven and a very hot oven
so let's go ahead and transfer those
into the center of a 475 degree oven for
about 8 to 10 minutes or so depends on
the size or until they're cooked through
and looking something like this check it
out hey those prawns down there just
happy to see me
so yes once cooked through those tails
should be standing straight up and
because we use such a hot oven some of
those Crump shins with crisp up nicely
so these are looking just about perfect
except for whatever reason one out of
every 12 does not assume the proper
shape and instead turns into what we
call in the business a humpback prawn
and the frustrating thing is nobody
knows why this happens I mean scientists
have been studying this for decades and
have absolutely no idea so I'm going to
go ahead and eat that one
after which I served up the rest next to
some lemon aioli and that's it what I'm
calling prawn Provencal is done and of
course crispy garlicky Irby breadcrumbs
are good on almost everything but when
you combine it with the sweetness of
that prawn it is an absolutely perfect
combination and by the way I know drive
some of you crazy when I double-dip but
it's fine my guests are in the other
room no one can see this but anyway
that's it what I'm calling prawn
Provencal is sure butterfly and all
those problems does take a little bit of
time but I think the resulting
appearance and taste is more than worth
it and they've been one of my go-to hot
orders for a long time
my only regret he rose I didn't use a
roasted red pepper ale which I think
would have made for more attractive
presentation but you know what that's
fine
life's too short for regrets especially
in the kitchen but anyway I realize
you're here for recipes now for life
coaching so with that let me finish up
by saying I really do hope you give this
a try soon head over to food wishes calm
for all the ingredients and more info as
usual and as always enjoy
you
[Music]
